SEARCH
Module org.example.game
Package world

Class World

java.lang.Object
world.World
public class World extends Object
Represents the 2D tile-based world, providing access to tiles, modification (mining/placing), and utility methods for collision and surface queries.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    World(TileType[][] tiles)
    Constructs a World from a pre-built 2D array of TileType.

  • Constructor Details

    • World

      public World(TileType[][] tiles)
      Constructs a World from a pre-built 2D array of TileType.
      Parameters:
      tiles - a non‐empty 2D array [row=y][col=x] of tiles

  • Method Details

    • getTile

      public TileType getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns the tile at (x,y), or AIR if (x,y) is outside the map bounds.
      Parameters:
      x - tile X coordinate
      y - tile Y coordinate
      Returns:
      the TileType at that position, or TileType.AIR if out of bounds

    • setTile

      public void setTile(int x, int y, TileType type)
      Sets the tile at (x,y) to the given type, if within bounds.
      Parameters:
      x - tile X coordinate
      y - tile Y coordinate
      type - the TileType to place

    • mineTile

      public void mineTile(int x, int y)
      “Mines” (destroys) the tile at (x,y).
      • If it’s not part of a tree, simply replaces it with AIR.
      • If it’s a tree tile, finds the TREE_MAIN stump in that column, removes the trunk and leaves around it, leaving only the stump.
      Parameters:
      x - tile X coordinate
      y - tile Y coordinate

    • placeTile

      public void placeTile(int x, int y, TileType type)
      Places a tile of the given type at (x,y).
      Parameters:
      x - tile X coordinate
      y - tile Y coordinate
      type - the TileType to place

    • isSolid

      public boolean isSolid(int x, int y)
      Returns whether the tile at (x,y) is solid for collision.
      • Out of vertical bounds (above/below) counts as solid;
      • Out of horizontal bounds counts as empty (allows exit);
      • Otherwise, delegates to TileType.isSolid().
      Parameters:
      x - tile X coordinate
      y - tile Y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if this position blocks movement

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns:
      map width in tiles

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns:
      map height in tiles

    • getSurfaceY

      public int getSurfaceY(int x)
      Finds the first non-AIR tile in column x, scanning from the top (y=0). If the entire column is AIR, returns the bottommost row.
      Parameters:
      x - tile X coordinate
      Returns:
      the Y coordinate of the surface

    • getTiles

      public TileType[][] getTiles()
      Returns the raw 2D tile array for iteration or export.
      Returns:
      the tiles[y][x] array
